thread.title: German police raid 45 properties in Hesse accused of plotting ISIS attack | World | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: German police raid 45 properties in Hesse accused of plotting ISIS attack | World | News | Express.co.uk

author: Charlie Bayliss
title: German police raid 45 properties in Hesse accused of plotting ISIS attack | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
BREAKING: 16 suspected ISIS jihadis 'plotting terror attacks' arrested in 54 German raids BREAKING: 16 suspected ISIS jihadis 'plotting terror attacks' arrested in 54 German raids GERMAN counter-terrorism police have carried out a whopping 54 raids on a group of alleged Islamic State supporters believed to be plotting an attack, authorities have said. PUBLISHED: 06:30, Wed, Feb 1, 2017 | UPDATED: 06:56, Wed, Feb 1, 2017 GETTY 16 alleged jihadis have been arrested in Germany 
The raids were carried out at 3am GMT (4am local time) in the western state of Hesse targeted 16 alleged would-be jihadis. 
Businesses, homes and mosques were targeted in the raids in Frankfurt, Darmstadt and Wiesbaden. Related articles Awkward Angela Merkel GRIMACES at her OWN REFLECTION 
The main suspect of the sting operation is a 36-year-old Tunisian man who has been arrested during a raid in Frankfurt. 
The unnamed man has been under investigation since August 2015 and is alleged to recruit and smuggle people for the Islamic death cult. 
The accused are between the ages of 16 and 46. 'MERKEL MUST GO': Brussels protest against German Chancellor Thu, January 12, 2017 Angry campaigners held placards with slogans reading 'Merkel not welcomed' and 'Merkel must go' following a spate of terror attacks against Germany.
